body.p: Below are descriptions that relate to one of the major structures of a skeletal muscle fiber. Please match the description to the proper part of the muscle fiber.

feedback.p: Incorrect. The sarcolemma is the plasma membrane and contains many transverse tubules.
Incorrect. Sarcoplasmic reticulum is similar to the endoplasmic reticulum and stores calcium in the terminal cisternae.
Incorrect. The Triad consists of one terminal cisternae and two transverse tubules
Correct. Myofibrils consist of actin and myosin proteins part of this structure is the Z disc.
Incorrect. Sarcoplasm is similar to cytoplasm of other cells.

body.p: Plasma membrane of a fused skeletal muscle cell

feedback.p: Correct. The sarcolemma is the plasma membrane and contains transverse tubules.
Incorrect. Sarcoplasmic reticulum is similar to the endoplasmic reticulum and stores calcium in the terminal cisternae.
Incorrect. The Triad consists of one terminal cisternae and two transverse tubules.
Incorrect. Myofibrils consist of actin and myosin proteins.
Incorrect. Sarcoplasm is similar to cytoplasm of other cells.

body.p: Contains a T tubule and two terminal cisternae

feedback.p: Incorrect. The sarcolemma is the plasma membrane and contains transverse tubules.
Incorrect. Sarcoplasmic reticulum is similar to the endoplasmic reticulum and stores calcium in the terminal cisternae.
Correct. The Triad consists of two terminal cisternae and one T tubule.
Incorrect. Myofibrils consist of actin and myosin proteins.
Incorrect. Sarcoplasm is similar to cytoplasm of other cells.
Incorrect. The sarcolemma is the plasma membrane and contains transverse tubules.
Incorrect. Sarcoplasmic reticulum is similar to the endoplasmic reticulum and stores calcium in the terminal cisternae.
Incorrect. The Triad consists of one terminal cisternae and two transverse tubules
Correct. Myofibrils consist of actin and myosin proteins. The M line is part of the myofibril structure.
Incorrect. Sarcoplasm is similar to cytoplasm of other cells.
Incorrect. The sarcolemma is the plasma membrane and contains transverse tubules.
Incorrect. Sarcoplasmic reticulum is similar to the endoplasmic reticulum and stores calcium in the terminal cisternae.
Incorrect. The Triad consists of one terminal cisternae and two transverse tubules.
Incorrect. Myofibrils consist of actin and myosin proteins.
Correct. Sarcoplasm is similar to cytoplasm of other cells and contains myoglobin.
Correct. The sarcolemma is the plasma membrane and contains transverse tubules.
Incorrect. Sarcoplasmic reticulum is similar to the endoplasmic reticulum and stores calcium in the terminal cisternae.
Incorrect. The Triad consists of one terminal cisternae and two transverse tubules
Incorrect. Myofibrils consist of actin and myosin proteins
Incorrect. Sarcoplasm is similar to cytoplasm of other cells.

feedback.p: Incorrect. The sarcolemma is the plasma membrane and contains transverse tubules.
Incorrect. Sarcoplasmic reticulum is similar to the endoplasmic reticulum and stores calcium in the terminal cisternae.
Incorrect. The Triad consists of one terminal cisternae and two transverse tubules.
Incorrect. Myofibrils consist of actin and myosin proteins.
Correct. Sarcoplasm is similar to cytoplasm of other cells.
Correct. The sarcolemma is the plasma membrane and contains transverse tubules.
Incorrect. Sarcoplasmic reticulum is similar to the endoplasmic reticulum and stores calcium in the terminal cisternae.
Incorrect. The Triad consists of one terminal cisternae and two transverse tubules.
Incorrect. Myofibrils consist of actin and myosin proteins.
Incorrect. Sarcoplasm is similar to cytoplasm of other cells.
Incorrect. The sarcolemma is the plasma membrane and contains transverse tubules.
Correct. Sarcoplasmic reticulum is similar to the endoplasmic reticulum and stores calcium in the terminal cisternae.
Incorrect. The Triad consists of one terminal cisternae and two transverse tubules.
Incorrect. Myofibrils consist of actin and myosin proteins.
Incorrect. Sarcoplasm is similar to cytoplasm of other cells.

body.p: Which of the following is correct about Ca2+ in skeletal muscle?

multiple_choice.choice: Binds to troponin of the sarcomeres.
Is stored in the T tubules.
It conducts the action potential in the sarcolemma
They are unique to muscle cells.

feedback.p: Correct. Ca2+ binds to the troponin in the sarcomeres so that muscle contraction can occur.
Incorrect. Ca2+ is stored in the sarcoplasmic reticulum.
Incorrect. Ca2+ is release from the sarcoplasmic reticulum as a result of an action potential.
Incorrect. Ca2+ are not ions that are unique to muscle cells

body.p: Why are the T tubules important for coordinating muscle contraction?

multiple_choice.choice: They conduct action potentials to the interior of the cell.
They prevent the release of Ca2+ ions.

feedback.p: Incorrect. Mitochondria produce ATP for energy.
Correct. T tubules are important for conducting action potentials deep into the cell.
Incorrect. The myoglobin in the sarcoplasm stores oxygen.
Incorrect. The T tubules conduct the action potential to release the Ca2+.
